tglkmeans 0.2.4

Simulate normal data for kmeans tests

simulate_data.Rd

Creates nclust clusters normally distributed around 1:nclust

simulate_data(n = 100, sd = 0.3, nclust = 30, dims = 2,
  frac_na = NULL, add_true_clust = TRUE)

Arguments

n

number of observations per cluster
sd

sd
nclust

number of clusters
dims

number of dimensions
frac_na

fraction of NA in the first dimension
add_true_clust

add a column with the true cluster ids

Value

simulated data

Examples

simulate_data(n = 100, sd = 0.3, nclust = 5, dims = 2)
#> # A tibble: 500 x 4
#>       id    V1    V2 true_clust
#>    <int> <dbl> <dbl>      <int>
#>  1     1 0.828 0.778          1
#>  2     2 1.24  0.852          1
#>  3     3 0.964 0.795          1
#>  4     4 0.707 1.16           1
#>  5     5 1.37  1.23           1
#>  6     6 0.750 1.42           1
#>  7     7 1.20  1.03           1
#>  8     8 1.33  0.841          1
#>  9     9 1.03  0.965          1
#> 10    10 1.14  0.871          1
#> # … with 490 more rows

# add 20% missing data
simulate_data(n = 100, sd = 0.3, nclust = 5, dims = 2, frac_na = 0.2)
#> # A tibble: 500 x 4
#>       id     V1    V2 true_clust
#>    <int>  <dbl> <dbl>      <int>
#>  1     1  0.429 1.54           1
#>  2     2 NA     1.12           1
#>  3     3  0.405 0.728          1
#>  4     4 NA     0.378          1
#>  5     5  0.910 1.33           1
#>  6     6 NA     0.960          1
#>  7     7  1.53  1.32           1
#>  8     8  0.988 0.992          1
#>  9     9  1.01  0.545          1
#> 10    10  0.597 1.50           1
#> # … with 490 more rows
